awd_titl_txt: Nonintegrable Phases and Nonlocality in Physics
awd_abstract_narration: This project addresses theoretical considerations                          regarding a "geometrical" phase (Berry's phase) by which the                    state of a quantum system changes if a closed path is traced in                 the space of parameters of the Hamiltonians of the system.                      This has been an active area for the past two or three years.                   This project will attempt to investigate the relativity between                 Berry's phase and electromagnetic and gravitational phases and                  to study the case of interacting systems.                                                                                                                            This theoretical work could lead to further experimental                   tests.  Since quantum interference effects from phase differ-                   ences have, in some cases, practical application, it is pos-                    sible that such application could eventually result from this                   work, but no immediate applications can be foreseen.
